top_rare_diseases.description: A rare, life-threatening disease that forms blood clots in small blood vessels throughout the body, leading to kidney failure.
top_rare_diseases.overview: aHUS is characterized by microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, acute kidney injury, and thrombocytopenia.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: If untreated, aHUS can lead to end-stage renal disease and mortality.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Genetic mutations (e.g., CFH, CD46, CFI), complement pathway dysregulation.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Laboratory tests for hemolysis, renal function, ADAMTS13 activity, and genetic testing.
clinical_trials: Investigation of Ravulizumab for adult aHUS
Phase 2 study of Zilucoplan in aHUS

top_rare_diseases.description: A rare kidney disease characterized by deposits in the glomeruli, leading to inflammation and kidney damage.
top_rare_diseases.overview: MPGN affects the glomeruli, causing proteinuria and hematuria, often progressing to chronic kidney disease.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Can lead to end-stage renal disease if untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Infections, autoimmune diseases, genetic factors, chronic diseases.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Kidney biopsy, urinalysis, blood tests for infections or autoimmune markers.
clinical_trials: Investigation of new biologics for MPGN

top_rare_diseases.description: A genetic disorder affecting the type IV collagen in the kidneys, leading to chronic kidney disease.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Characterized by hematuria, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities, progressing to kidney failure.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Progressive kidney disease often leading to end-stage renal disease.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Mutations in COL4A3, COL4A4, or COL4A5 genes.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Family history, audiology tests, genetic testing, kidney biopsy.
clinical_trials: Study of anti-fibrotic agents in Alport
key_aspects: Genetic mutation in type IV collagen

top_rare_diseases.description: An autoimmune disease attacking the lungs and kidneys, leading to bleeding and kidney inflammation.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Characterized by anti-GBM antibodies causing glomerulonephritis and pulmonary hemorrhage.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Rapid progression to kidney failure and severe lung issues.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Autoantibodies against glomerular and alveolar basement membranes.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Anti-GBM antibody tests, chest X-ray, urine analysis.

top_rare_diseases.description: A rare genetic disorder causing the buildup of a particular type of fat in the body's cells.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Leads to pain, kidney failure, heart issues, and nervous system involvement.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Progressive organ damage, especially kidneys, heart, and nerves.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Deficiency of alpha-Gal A enzyme due to GLA gene mutation.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Enzyme activity assay, genetic testing, clinical evaluation.
key_aspects: Symptoms in early age but can present later
